definitions: being chased or followed with intent to capture or harm
actively sought after or strived for with determination and effort
examples: The pursued suspect ran through narrow alleyways
A pursued animal often becomes more dangerous
She felt pursued by persistent doubts and fears
The most pursued goals often prove the most elusive

definitions: engaged in following or chasing someone or something to catch them
actively working toward achieving a particular goal or objective over time
examples: The pursuing officers closed in on the fugitive
A pursuing vehicle sped through the intersection
Students pursuing advanced degrees face many challenges
The company is pursuing new markets in Asia

definitions: infected and containing or discharging pus as a medical condition
having soft fur like a cat; furry and soft to touch
examples: The wound became pussy and required medical attention
A pussy infection needs immediate antibiotic treatment
The pussy willow branches felt soft against her skin
Those pussy catkins appear in early spring gardens

definitions: generally regarded or considered to be something though not necessarily so
assumed to exist or to have existed but without conclusive proof
examples: The putative father refused to take a paternity test
Several putative solutions failed to solve the problem
The putative author of the manuscript remains unknown
Their putative relationship was never officially confirmed

definitions: unable to understand or explain something; confused and uncertain
displaying confusion or bewilderment through facial expression or behavior
examples: She felt puzzled by his strange behavior yesterday
The students looked puzzled during the complex lecture
His puzzled expression revealed his complete confusion
The dog tilted its head with a puzzled look

definitions: causing someone to feel confused because difficult to understand or explain
presenting a problem or mystery that is hard to solve or comprehend
examples: The detective found several puzzling clues at the scene
Her puzzling behavior worried her closest friends
This puzzling mathematical theorem took years to prove
The results showed a puzzling pattern of data

definitions: having the shape of a pyramid with triangular sides meeting at a point
arranged in layers with each level smaller than the one below it
examples: The pyramidal roof gave the building a distinctive look
Ancient cultures built massive pyramidal monuments
The company maintains a pyramidal management structure
Pyramidal neurons have a distinctive triangular cell body

definitions: relating to or involving fireworks or the art of making them
resembling fireworks in being brilliantly colorful, dramatic, or spectacular
examples: The pyrotechnic display lit up the night sky
Strict pyrotechnic safety regulations prevented accidents
Her pyrotechnic guitar solo amazed the audience
The chef's pyrotechnic cooking skills drew crowds

definitions: describing a victory gained at such great cost that it amounts to defeat
examples: Their pyrrhic victory left the army too weak to continue
Winning the lawsuit proved a pyrrhic triumph
The pyrrhic nature of their success became apparent later
It was a pyrrhic achievement that destroyed the company

definitions: relating to a person who dishonestly claims medical knowledge or skills
making or relating to the characteristic harsh sound made by ducks
examples: The quack doctor sold worthless remedies to patients
Authorities shut down several quack medical clinics
The quack sounds echoed across the pond
Her quack imitation made the children laugh

definitions: having four angles and four sides; shaped like a quadrangle or rectangle
examples: The quadrangular courtyard provided a peaceful retreat
Medieval castles often featured quadrangular tower designs
A quadrangular playing field hosted the match
The building's quadrangular floor plan maximized space

definitions: involving the second and no higher power of an unknown quantity or variable
examples: Students learned to solve quadratic equations in class
The quadratic formula provides solutions to these problems
A quadratic function produces a parabolic curve
This quadratic relationship appears throughout physics

definitions: having four straight sides as a flat geometric shape or figure
examples: A square is a special type of quadrilateral shape
The quadrilateral plot of land needed surveying
Students identified various quadrilateral figures in geometry class
The quadrilateral design appeared throughout the architecture

definitions: consisting of four times the usual amount, number, or size
having four parts, elements, or components working together as one
examples: The company achieved quadruple profits this year
A quadruple dose would be dangerously excessive
The quadruple alliance united four powerful nations
Their quadruple vocal harmony impressed the judges

definitions: attractively unusual or old-fashioned in a charming and appealing way
having an unusual character that provokes interest though seeming odd
examples: The quaint village attracted many tourists each year
She loved the quaint customs of rural life
His quaint way of speaking amused his colleagues
The shop sold quaint antiques and curiosities

definitions: having the necessary skills, knowledge, or experience for a particular job
limited in some way; not complete or absolute but modified by conditions
examples: Only qualified applicants will be interviewed
She's highly qualified for the senior position
The proposal received qualified approval from the board
His qualified praise left everyone feeling uncertain

definitions: relating to or measured by quality rather than quantity or numerical values
examples: The research used qualitative methods like interviews
Qualitative analysis revealed important patterns
There's been a qualitative improvement in performance
The qualitative differences between samples were striking

definitions: of a high standard or superior grade indicating excellence
examples: They only sell quality products at premium prices
This store specializes in quality furniture
A quality education prepares students for success
She appreciates quality time with her family

definitions: able to be expressed or measured as a quantity or numerical amount
examples: The benefits are easily quantifiable in monetary terms
Not all improvements are quantifiable through statistics
They need quantifiable results to justify the investment
The quantifiable data supported their hypothesis strongly

definitions: relating to or measured by quantity rather than quality; expressed numerically
examples: The study employed quantitative research methods exclusively
Quantitative analysis revealed significant statistical patterns
They need quantitative data to support their claims
The quantitative approach yielded precise measurements

definitions: kept in isolation to prevent spread of contagious disease or contamination
examples: The quarantined patients remained in separate facilities
All quarantined animals undergo thorough health checks
The quarantined ship waited offshore for clearance
Quarantined files protect computers from potential viruses

definitions: given to quarreling; disposed to argue or fight readily over trivial matters
examples: His quarrelsome nature made him difficult to work with
The quarrelsome neighbors constantly complained about everything
A quarrelsome drunk started trouble at the bar
Their quarrelsome relationship exhausted their friends

definitions: occurring, issued, or paid at three-month intervals four times per year
examples: The company publishes quarterly financial reports
Shareholders receive quarterly dividend payments
Their quarterly meeting reviews business performance
The magazine has quarterly issues throughout the year

definitions: seemingly or apparently but not really; having some resemblance
having a partial, approximate, or incomplete resemblance to something
examples: The organization operates as a quasi governmental agency
This quasi scientific theory lacks proper evidence
They formed a quasi official committee
The quasi legal status created confusion

definitions: strange, odd, or unusual in an unsettling or suspicious way
relating to sexual or gender identities outside heterosexual and cisgender norms
examples: Something queer happened at the abandoned house
He noticed a queer smell coming from the basement
The queer community celebrates diversity and inclusion
Queer studies examines gender and sexuality

definitions: suppressed or ended forcibly; put down by force or authority
examples: The quelled rebellion left the region under martial law
His quelled emotions finally erupted unexpectedly
The quelled protests resulted in many arrests
Their quelled hopes never fully recovered

definitions: put out or extinguished; satisfied fully as with thirst or desire
examples: The quenched fire left only smoking embers
Her quenched thirst allowed her to continue
His quenched ambition left him feeling empty
The quenched steel had superior strength

definitions: open to doubt or challenge; not clearly true, honest, or acceptable
of doubtful morality, honesty, or respectability; potentially improper
examples: The witness provided questionable testimony in court
These questionable statistics need further verification
His questionable business practices attracted investigation
They made questionable decisions under pressure

definitions: showing doubt or uncertainty about something through expression or manner
characterized by or expressing a desire to know or understand something
examples: Her questioning look suggested she didn't believe him
The questioning tone in his voice revealed skepticism
The child's questioning mind explored everything eagerly
A questioning approach helps students learn better

definitions: moving or able to move with great speed and agility
done or occurring in a short time with minimal delay
showing mental alertness and ability to respond or understand rapidly
examples: The quick fox jumped over the lazy dog
She made a quick escape through the window
We need a quick solution to this problem
He grabbed a quick lunch between meetings
Her quick mind grasped complex concepts easily
A quick student always finishes assignments early

definitions: changing rapidly and unpredictably in mood, direction, or character
resembling mercury in being fluid, elusive, and difficult to grasp
examples: Her quicksilver moods made her unpredictable
The market showed quicksilver volatility today
His quicksilver movements evaded every attempt
The quicksilver nature of fame became apparent

definitions: in a state of inactivity or dormancy; quiet and still but capable of becoming active
examples: The quiescent volcano hadn't erupted for decades
The disease remained quiescent for several years
During winter, many plants become quiescent
The quiescent period ended with sudden activity

definitions: making little or no noise; characterized by an absence of sound
peaceful and calm without activity or disturbance
not showy or bright; understated and restrained in style
examples: The quiet library provided perfect study conditions
Please be quiet while the baby sleeps
We enjoyed a quiet evening at home together
The quiet countryside offered a peaceful retreat
She wore a quiet gray suit to the interview
His quiet confidence impressed everyone

definitions: made of two layers of fabric with soft material between them held by stitching
examples: The quilted jacket provided excellent warmth
She loved her grandmother's quilted bedspread
A quilted bag protected the laptop perfectly
The quilted pattern added decorative texture

definitions: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
examples: She was the quintessential English lady
This is the quintessential example of Gothic architecture
He became the quintessential villain in movies
Their product represents quintessential Italian design

definitions: consisting of five times the usual amount, number, or size
having five parts, elements, or components working together
examples: The investment yielded quintuple returns
A quintuple bypass surgery saved his life
The quintuple alliance included five nations
Their quintuple win streak broke records

definitions: having unusual traits or behaviors that are interesting and appealing
examples: Her quirky personality made her memorable
The quirky cafe attracted artistic customers
He had quirky habits that amused his friends
The movie's quirky humor appealed to audiences

definitions: on equal terms with no debt or obligation remaining between parties
examples: After paying back the loan, we're finally quits
Let's call it quits and remain friends
If you return the favor, we'll be quits
They decided to call it quits after years

definitions: relating to rabbis or to Jewish law and teachings as interpreted by rabbis
examples: Students studied ancient rabbinic texts intensively
The rabbinic tradition shaped Jewish law
Rabbinic authority guided the community's practices
This rabbinic interpretation offered new insights

definitions: of or relating to rabbis, their teachings, or their interpretation of Jewish law
examples: He attended a prestigious rabbinical seminary
Rabbinical scholars debated the text's meaning
The rabbinical court made important decisions
Her rabbinical studies took many years

definitions: affected with rabies; showing symptoms of this fatal viral disease
extremely enthusiastic, devoted, or fanatical about beliefs or interests
examples: The rabid dog had to be quarantined immediately
A rabid bat was found in the attic
His rabid fans followed him everywhere
She's a rabid supporter of environmental causes

definitions: relating to or connected with differences between races or ethnic groups
examples: The country struggled with racial inequality
Racial diversity enriches our community
They faced racial discrimination at work
The study examined racial disparities in healthcare

definitions: showing prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism against people of other races
examples: The racist comments sparked widespread outrage
Their racist policies excluded minority groups
A racist attitude pervaded the institution
She confronted the racist behavior directly

definitions: causing intense physical or mental suffering, pain, or anguish
examples: She endured racking pain throughout the night
The racking cough kept him awake
It was a racking decision to make
The racking guilt consumed him completely

definitions: having content that is mildly indecent or suggestive; risqu√©
full of zest, vigor, or excitement; spirited and lively
examples: The racy novel contained adult themes
His racy jokes made some people uncomfortable
She drove a racy red sports car
The racy storyline kept readers engaged

definitions: arranged like rays extending outward from a common center point
examples: The radial pattern spread from the center
Radial tires provide better road grip
The city's radial highways converge downtown
A radial design decorated the ceiling

definitions: sending out light; shining or glowing brightly with emitted energy
obviously very happy, healthy, or beautiful; glowing with positive emotion
examples: The radiant sun warmed the earth below
Radiant heat emanated from the fireplace
The bride looked radiant on her wedding day
Her radiant smile lit up the room

definitions: spreading outward from a central point in lines or rays
examples: The radiate pattern decorated the ancient shield
Radiate structures appear throughout nature
The radiate design centered on the fountain
These radiate forms create visual harmony

definitions: extending or spreading outward from a central point
sending out energy, light, heat, or other emissions
examples: The radiating lines created a sunburst pattern
Radiating cracks spread across the windshield
The radiating heat warmed the entire room
Her radiating confidence inspired the team

definitions: relating to or affecting fundamental nature of something; far-reaching
advocating thorough political or social reform; representing extreme views
very thorough and complete; going to the root of matters
examples: The company underwent radical restructuring
These radical changes transformed the industry
Her radical views alienated moderate supporters
The radical movement gained momentum
The surgery required radical removal of tissue
They took radical measures to save costs
